author: pipermerriam
content: lack of interest is likely just that historically there hasn't been a compelling enough reason to change formats because the cost on tooling will be high.  Climate is different in this context because ASE may force us to change address formats, and if we're gonna change them, we can incorperate something like bech32 alongside the size extension to improve UX at the tooling layer (if there is sufficient will to do so)

author: sky.cactus
content: I think in general, the address size extension gives us an opportunity to address a number of problems at the same time because tooling will all be forced to support a new type of address.

author: sky.cactus
content: We can use a better encoding scheme (not base 16), we can add an Ethereum-specific prefix, we can potentially add chain ID specificity, we can add a CRC check into the address itself, etc.

author: treyzania
content: I'm not sure what the expected wallet design around it should look like but it might be worth considering if addresses should contain more than just a chain id but also a tag specifying like "which rollup am I expecting the funds to be delivered on?"
